Reviews.Title: “Never Dissappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: ejjPortDeposit_MD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Lankford many, many times!! The best word for this very old hotel is "quaint"!! If you are looking for luxury then you might want to look elsewhere...I do love being pampered at hotels but when I go to Ocean City I just want a place to sleep, without paying an arm and a leg, so I can just enjoy the beach...and this is what you have right out the door of the Lankford....the beach.... I am very picky about cleanliness and the Lankford definitely meets my expectations. The rooms are very small but again, they are fine for either my daughter and myself or my husband and myself...The beds are just ok. The one thing I wish they would upgrade are the comforters and the blankets....They aren't as nice as I would like...If you watch alot of tv while away, you might be dissappointed...the tv's are about a 13 inch I believe...we don't watch much tv at the beach therefore these tv's are absolutely fine for us... I love the morning compimentary breakfast...the variety is small but sufficient for me. They have bagels, muffins, pastries, toast, coffee, and juices. There are no elevators so be prepared to go up and down steps.. Again, this is not a problem for me and my family. Sisters, Mary and Sara, are the owners... they are very accomodating and become like family when you go as often as I do....their children are always around being helpful as well.... The location is the best part of staying at the Lankford!!! It is located on the boardwalk, on 8th street....therefore, you literally walk out the front door, cross over the boards, and you are on the beach....I love that!!! If you are looking for a place at the beach to visit often, without going bankrupt, the Lankford is the perfect place!! I come here many times thoughout the spring and summer seasons and I am NEVER DISSAPPOINTERD....

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: travelcruzer99
Reviews.Content: Great place to relax in Ocean City. They have kept the Old Charm and that is rare. The family that owns the hotel is great and they keep the rooms very clean. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: doglover1972
Reviews.Content: This is a family run hotel. It is right on the Boardwalk, cheap, and clean. Very friendly, relaxed atmosphere. Free, upgraded continental breakfast in mornings. I have stayed here many times, and will continue. Feels very safe, clean, and very affordable. No pool, and a little dated, but quaint. I would recomend The Lankford Hotel to anyone on a budget or with familys.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: Family-owned, the Lankford Hotel is actually a series of five buildings with a range of options from standard hotel rooms to full apartments. The family that owns and runs it was there all the time, or so it seemed, and they were very helpful. I stayed there Friday and Saturday of Labor Day weekend (the traditional end of the beach season), and the rates were surprisingly low. I had a room for two nights. It was a bit on the smallish side and sparsely furnished (no desk), but clean and comfortable. There was a ceiling fan, which was nice, and the shower had a liquid-soap dispenser in it, which was also a nice touch. A continental breakfast (toast, bagels, danishes, coffee, tea and juices) is included each morning. Did I mention that it's right on the Ocean City boardwalk and steps away from the beach? And that it has a front porch and second-floor balcony overlooking the boardwalk from which you can watch the legions of passers-by? On-site parking meant not having to feed the voracious Ocean City meters, and my car never left the lot the entire time I was there. By the way, the hotel is 80-plus years old, so there's no elevator (at least not in the building I stayed in), and the free WiFi was only available in the lobby, but if those aren't issues for you, I can heartily recommend the Lankford.

Reviews.Title: “Basic motel but great location”
Reviews.Author: April109
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect since it is right on the boardwalk. We went with another couple and shared a two bedroom room. Each room has a private entrance but has a shared bathroom. There was only a double bed, single bed, tv and dresser in each room. We paid an additional $8 a night for a dorm size refrigerator. No hairdryers or coffee makers but they do offer coffee and bagels in the lobby each morning. The place was very basic and outdated but for the location and price, it was worth it. If you stay at the hotel, not the lodge, you have to be in the hotel by 2:30 AM or they lock the doors.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Boarding House Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MsPZ
Reviews.Content: This quaint property is run by very friendly and accomodating folks. The rooms are simple and a throw back to the 50's - that's not a bad thing. A simple continental breakfast was available in the morning. There's a large front porch with rockers right on the boardwalk. A great location. On Cruisers' weekend, we had solos, couples and a group staying here. The group was composed of ladies who were into needle work. They gathered in the parlor twice a day and were having a merry old time. They were from the Delaware Valley and stay at the Lankford every year. Rates are reasonable. Plenty of towels and soap, but bring your shampoo, conditioner and hair dryer. This is not a Country Inn & Suites, Holiday Inn Express or Marriott Courtyard. But I had a great time and felt very comfortable staying here as a solo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherrb37
Reviews.Content: We picked the Lankford because of the reveiws we read on it and they were dead on. This hotel is perfect for the traveler that is not looking for a chain. It has awesome hospitality and service. Everyone was very friendly and made you feel as though you were staying with family. The whole place was spotless, our rooms were comfortable, the location was perfect and the price was great. It was like staying at a real beach hotel. There was even a complimentary continental breakfast in the morning. The bathroom was pretty small but then how much time do you really spend iin there? I was very immpressed and will be staying there again next time I go to OC. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “medical emergency - no refund!”
Reviews.Author: p3couple
Reviews.Content: as much as i love The Lankford Hotel and have stayed there many times through the years i was really disappointed by the greater concern for business over compassion for people. let me explain...my husband and i had made a reservation for a long weekend trip which we were REALLY looking forward to, but unfortunately my husband had to be admitted to the hospital with a bowel abscess the day before we were to leave! hoping that he could leave the next morning (friday) he was seen by a surgeon who told him this was serious and he would have to stay at least until Sunday! i called right away when we received this news, and was told that if the room was rented we could apply the deposit to another reservation, or receive a refund, whichever we decided. I was truly shocked-canceling for a medical emergency should really be an exception to the rule! when i called to make a new reservations, i was told by the owner that the room was only rented for one night so NO REFUND! sorry to say, but this made me think, "What would Betty and Warren Frame have done in this situation?"!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Beachfront”
Reviews.Author: Bolinins
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed in a couple of different rooms of this old beauty. No elevator so be prepared for the long hike to the third floor if you take one of these rooms-dark paneling throughout, not very modern, but quiet and comfortable. A huge front porch at boardwalk level and another upstairs with rocking chairs-perfect for watching the sunrise over the ocean. The AC in our room would freeze us out when left on. We rented the Robins Nest apartment (lower unit) just off the ramp behind Thrasher's French Fries on 8th Street. Front porch, close to bike rentals and anything else you could want (no pool, sorry!) This apartment is very modern and extremely well kept. The free continental breakfast in the Hotel's main lobby is just a short walk across their parking lot. Yes, they have private parking and it's right there near the apartment so no long walks, plus there is a convenience store for milk, bread, etc... right down the alley out back. The staff is great, plus they seem to bring over guys and girls from Ireland with the greatest accent and best manner's we encountered anywhere on our trips. The price is right, location is great and we felt right at home the minute we arrived. If you don't like old paneling & plumbing, then make sure to get an apartment (yes, they will set up a time to tour it if you ask!) We've stayed many times and always come back for more. Have been unable to go there for a few years now for other reasons, but am planning a stay again in August 2009.

Reviews.Title: “time travel at the beach”
Reviews.Author: xmasinjunebride
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here quite a few times since 2001 and will again in 2009 and beyond--first as a single woman looking spontaneously for a place to stay at my local beach, then with my sister in a room with two twin beds, then with my fiance, and now again with my husband. I have recommended it to my parents and friends and they enjoyed it too. Basically whenever a family member is coming to OC, I recommend they stay here--it's like an old timey Waltons family beach cottage--the sun shines in during the breakfast time and you can sit on the porch to eat which IS LITERALLY FIVE STEPS FROM THE BOARDWALK AND BEACH! That was the real draw for me initially, plus the tall white porch columns and the rocking chairs. As a single woman, I always felt safe and could just luxuriate in the beach experience. There is a great 2nd/3rd floor balcony with rocking chairs too to watch the sunset. During off season, the prices are especially reasonable--cheaper than most modern chain motels in a typical non-beach city elsewhere; even during summer peak, it's the best deal on the BOARDWALK! It's not fancy or "high end," but an old fashioned, antiques-in-the-hall, creaky stairs, beachfront sunset, travel back in time with your grandma kind of place at grandma's prices. Good setting for a Miss Marple mystery--great for writing or relaxing and just enjoying life!

Reviews.Title: “We stay their every year”
Reviews.Author: kay3md
Reviews.Content: The Lankford is an older hotel with lots of charm. We have been staying there for over 20 years. It is in a perfect location in old Ocean City, right on the beach and within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, boardwalk games and a playground. It is definitely a family hotel, and not a place for young singles.

Reviews.Title: “Homely Environment”
Reviews.Author: liluqt
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to OC and I went with my boyfriend and parents. I wasn't sure what to expect as I had booked literally the night before for a 2 night stay at the Lankford. Despite having lived in MD my entire life, my family never made the trek to OC and boy did they have a great experience. The hotel is old, but that added to the character. The staff was extremely friendly and when my BF asked about fishing spots, one of the staff members hopped on his personal cell and made a call to a good friend of his to ask questions. That's service!! They had a warm breakfast first thing in the morning which included coffee, doughnuts, oj, and croissants. Don't expect to spend all day at the hotel as there really isn't a lot of amenities there for you, but it's just perfect for a place to rest your head after a day on the beach and the price and view were excellent during peak season. My parents' favorite thing to do while there was sit on the porch and people watch. I am planning another trip back and if we weren't toting along a 1 and 2 year old, I would definitely go back to stay. This hotel may be suitable for older children, but I wouldn't recommend really young ones to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: MegaCombo
Reviews.Content: My family & I have been staying here in the summer for years. We love it for its old time ambiance, big porches with rocking chairs, that it is family run, VERY clean, reasonably priced, ...I can go on forever. We pray that The Lankford doesn't cave in & sell to a developer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful "family" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Doriguzzis
Reviews.Content: This will be our family's 22nd year at the Lankford. Have stayed in several different apartments at this hotel and all of them have been excellent. The "Lankford family" have been very very cordial to us over the years. Would not think of staying anyplace else in Ocean City!!! Staying in the Lodge East again this year.......very nice porch, apartment and view. Would recommend this hotel highly for a "family vacation". Can't wait to spend our week this year (2007) at the Lankford. The Doriguzzi's...Fredericktown, Pa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: svjanis
Reviews.Content: Nice family-owned hotel on the Boardwalk. Large comfortable lobby and wide porch with rocking chairs. Owners and staff quickly resolve any concerns. Returning for a second visit this summer!
